H0.text: What Greek-based word is the second most important character in a drama, behind the protagonist. Deuteragon

H1.text: What Greek-based word is the second most important character in a drama, behind the protagonist. Heteragonist

H2.text: What Greek-based word is the second most important character in a drama, behind the protagonist. Protagonistos

H3.text: What Greek-based word is the second most important character in a drama, behind the protagonist. Deutergonist

A4.text: The term deuteragonist is derived from the Greek δευτεραγωνιστής (deuteragōnistḗs), meaning 'second actor'.

A5.text: Aeschylus introduced the deuteragonist, as noted by Aristotle in his Poetics.
